video.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
video.synopsis: This CNN original series has chef Anthony Bourdain traveling to extraordinary locations around the globe to sample a variety of local cuisines.

episodes.synopsis: Bourdain explores one of the most fabled and beautiful areas of Asia, immersing himself in a culture typically beyond the reach of Western eyes.
episodes.title: Myanmar

episodes.synopsis: Bourdain explores the area of Los Angeles known as Koreatown, where he finds a tight-knit community still marked by the 1992 Rodney King riots.
episodes.title: Los Angeles (Koreatown)

episodes.synopsis: Tony explores several regions of Colombia, from the mountains to the Caribbean coast to the coca leaf-growing inlands once controlled by drug cartels.
episodes.title: Colombia

episodes.synopsis: Bourdain explores post-war Libya through personal stories, food and the music of anti-Qaddafi rapper expats who returned to fight.
episodes.title: Libya

episodes.synopsis: Two of the funniest and most brilliant chefs and restaurateurs in Canada, Joe Beef's Dave McMillan and Fred Morin, take us across Canada by rail.
episodes.title: Quebec

episodes.synopsis: Tony explores the "Interzone," where many artists have sought the possibilities of great empty spaces and escape from Western moral prohibitions.
episodes.title: Tangier (Morocco)

episodes.synopsis: Bourdain looks at the Congo as one of the more industrialized powers in Africa that's now largely crumbled to nothingness and chaos.
episodes.title: Congo

episodes.synopsis: Tony and his friend, world-renowned chef Eric Ripert, explore the far reaches of the indigenous Andes in search of a rare variety of wild cocoa.
episodes.title: Peru

episodes.synopsis: While the political situation in Israel, the West Bank and Gaza is often tense, Anthony concentrates on the region's history, food and culture.
episodes.title: Jerusalem

episodes.synopsis: Anthony explores Andalucía during Semana Santa (Holy Week, leading up to Easter), a time filled with great pageantry and excitement.
episodes.title: Spain

episodes.synopsis: Anthony looks at the mash-up of cultures that comprise this unique state by sampling its food, and he explores the area's equally unusual underbelly.
episodes.title: New Mexico

episodes.synopsis: Denmark's economic and cultural center is home to chef Rene Redzepi and his brainchild, Noma, which is regarded one of the world's best restaurants.
episodes.title: Copenhagen

episodes.synopsis: With help from enthusiastic, fast-talking sidekicks, Anthony eats his way around the island on a quest for foods that embody the Sicilian way of life.
episodes.title: Sicily

episodes.synopsis: Anthony visits a dicey suburb, spends a day in the life of a taxi driver, and discovers the culture and food that make up modern-day Johannesburg.
episodes.title: South Africa

episodes.synopsis: Japan's rigid culture gives way to some unique subcultures. Anthony revisits Tokyo in search of the city's dark and bizarrely fetishistic underside.
episodes.title: Tokyo

episodes.synopsis: Anthony explores the Motor City's past and future, as he glimpses at Packard's heyday and visits citizens who are rebuilding their fallen communities.
episodes.title: Detroit

episodes.synopsis: Tony explores Punjab, one of the most beautiful and unknown areas of India. Punjab is the Sikh Holy Land and is also India's agricultural breadbasket.
episodes.title: Punjab

episodes.synopsis: Anthony and food writer Michael Ruhlman tour Las Vegas, visiting locations like the Huntridge Tavern and José Andrés's restaurant, é.
episodes.title: Las Vegas

episodes.synopsis: Anthony accompanies chef and restaurateur Daniel Boulud in Boulud's hometown of Lyon, France, for a pilgrimage of the city's rich food culture.
episodes.title: Lyon

episodes.synopsis: Anthony travels to Mexico City, Oaxaca and Cuernavaca, where residents express their passion through food, art and the struggle for an improved life.
episodes.title: Mexico

episodes.synopsis: Anthony takes in the food and history of the Mississippi Delta, including Jackson's Big Apply Inn, known as a civil rights-era gathering place.
episodes.title: Mississippi

episodes.synopsis: On the eve of the Olympics in Sochi, Tony visits Russia. He confers with prominent locals and explores the drinking and dining scene.
episodes.title: Russia

episodes.synopsis: Tony takes to the streets of Thailand, where he meets up with celebrated chef Andy Ricker while on the hunt for some late-night grub.
episodes.title: Thailand

episodes.synopsis: Anthony travels to Brazil and visits Bahia, the center of African culture in the country, as well as Capoeira and Salvadoran fishing neighborhoods.
episodes.title: Brazil

episodes.synopsis: While sampling home-style cuisine, Anthony chats it up with locals in glittering Shanghai who discuss China's thriving economy.
episodes.title: Shanghai

episodes.synopsis: Anthony checks out art, music and food -- including deep-fried cuts of pork -- in the vibrant New York City borough of the Bronx.
episodes.title: The Bronx

episodes.synopsis: While looking into the mysterious history of a Bourdain family ancestor, Anthony samples Paraguayan dishes such as bife koygua and bori-bori.
episodes.title: Paraguay

episodes.synopsis: In the city of Hue, Anthony checks out a massive open-air market and tries local dishes like bird's nest soup and clams with rice.
episodes.title: Vietnam

episodes.synopsis: On safari, Anthony encounters lions and elephants, and in Zanzibar, he relishes grilled seafood, mandazi and Zanzibari pizza.
episodes.title: Tanzania

episodes.synopsis: In politically charged Iran, Anthony visits Tehran and Isfahan to sample biryani, tahdig, dizi and other tasty Persian fare.
episodes.title: Iran

episodes.synopsis: Anthony visits his old stomping grounds in Provincetown, Massachusetts, and investigates the explosion of heroin addiction in small New England towns.
episodes.title: Massachusetts

episodes.synopsis: Between bites of delectable Caribbean cuisine, Anthony explores Jamaica's tourist industry and the musical legacy of Bob Marley.
episodes.title: Jamaica

episodes.synopsis: Anthony spends a week in South Korea doing karaoke, drinking to excess and dining on Korean fried chicken, silkworm larva soup and hot dog stew.
episodes.title: Korea

episodes.synopsis: In Miami, Anthony dines with punk icon Iggy Pop, talks Cubano sandwiches with chef Michelle Bernstein and meets the 100-year-old owner of Club Deuce.
episodes.title: Miami

episodes.synopsis: From Glasgow to the Scottish Highlands, Anthony indulges in savory favorites like deep-fried haggis, lobster thermidor and lamb curry.
episodes.title: Scotland

episodes.synopsis: Anthony talks Hungarian history with renowned cinematographer Vilmos Zsigmond and dines on venison stew, pork schnitzel and other meaty favorites.
episodes.title: Budapest

episodes.synopsis: Accompanied by director Darren Aronofsky, Anthony explores the African island and dines on a special goose dish prepared by a well-known local chef.
episodes.title: Madagascar

episodes.synopsis: In their native New Jersey, Anthony and his brother Chris dine on local favorites like fried clams and Jersey-style Italian sandwiches.
episodes.title: New Jersey

episodes.synopsis: Anthony travels off the beaten path to Molokai and joins the locals for a feast featuring slow-roasted pig, kala fish and octopus.
episodes.title: Hawaii

episodes.synopsis: On a return trip to Beirut, Anthony samples local favorites like hummus and grape leaves and shares a meal with writer and activist Joumana Haddad.
episodes.title: Beirut
